meanings.definition: To give a wrong or inappropriate name to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally misnamed her cat as 'Doggy'.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misname the characters in the story.
meanings.sent3: The misnaming of the new student caused confusion in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: His tendency to misname things turned the office into a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of misnaming can be quite embarrassing.

meanings.definition: To call someone or something by the wrong name.
meanings.sent1: He always misnames his coworkers during meetings.
meanings.sent2: It is impolite to misname someone on purpose.
meanings.sent3: The misnaming of the famous actor led to a hilarious mix-up.
meanings.sent4: She felt like misnaming the city as a magical land from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's habit of misnaming students became a running joke in the class.
